name: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Sanding Sealer B‑1254

info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Sanding Sealer B‑1254 is a commercial grade nitrocellulose-based sealer for wood. It is used before finishing with either gloss or flat lacquer. It requires less sanding and has good sealing and hold-out properties.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: It is ideal for interior sealed wood such as furniture, store fixtures, cabinets, doors, and panels.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.body: Sand surface until wood is smooth to the touch. Hammer all nails deep enough to apply wood filler. Dust off surfaces completely then wipe with a clean rag.   If repainting, remove all paint by using manual or mechanical methods prior to the application of BOYSEN®® Lacquer Sanding Sealer.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.body: Stain: BOYSEN®® Oil Wood Stain (optional) Sealer Coat: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Sanding Sealer B‑1254, sanded lightly before topcoat application Final coat: BOYSEN®® Clear Gloss Lacquer B‑1250, Clear Dead Flat Lacquer B‑1253, or Water White Clear Gloss Lacquer B‑1258

info.title: SERVICE CONDITIONS
info.body: If necessary, add approximately 10% by volume of BOYSEN®® Lacquer Flo B‑1205 to the ready-to-use mixture.

info.title: MATERIAL PREPARATION
info.body: 10% by volume of BOYSEN®® Lacquer Flo B‑1205 is added to the ready-to-use topcoat mixture just before application to prevent moisture blushing during relatively cold or damp climate conditions.
